Name: Amulet of a sow
Description: Crudely modelled faience figurine of a sow, used on account of its voracious appetite as an emblem of the sky-goddess Nut, who swallows her children the stars. In the first millennium BC, the role is also allotted to Isis. Faience amulets of this type are common in the Late Period, after 700 BC.
